Title: Exercise on a holomorphic $f$ on a strip satisfying $|f(z)|\leq A(1+|z|)^\eta$
AcceptedAnswer: Just fix $R=1/2$, estimate $3/2+|x| \le 3/2(1+|x|)$, and include $(3/2)^\eta$ in your $A_n$.

###BEGIN_OF_FORMAT###
Assumption: 
$f$ is holomorphic on the strip $S = \{z = x + iy : -1 < y < 1, x \in \mathbb{R}\}$,
$|f(z)| \leq A(1 + |z|)^\eta$ for all $z \in S$ where $\eta$ is a fixed real number,
$R$ satisfies $0 < R < 1$,
The Cauchy inequality is applied to circles $x + C_R$ centered at $x \in \mathbb{R}$ with radius $R$.
Problem: 
Show that for each integer $n \geq 0$, there exists $A_n \geq 0$ such that $|f^{(n)}(x)| \leq A_n(1 + |x|)^\eta$ for all $x \in \mathbb{R}$.
